Navigation
Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Map/invert

Synopsis Invert the (key,value) pairs in a map.
Function map[&V, set[&K]] invert(map[&K, &V] M)
Description Returns inverted map in which each value in the old map M is associated with a set of key values from the old map. Also see invertUnique.
Examples 
rascal>import Map;
ok
rascal>invert(("apple": 1, "pear": 2, "ananas": 1));
map[int, set[str]]: (
  2:{"pear"},
  1:{"ananas","apple"}
)
